sessions.title: Welcome Ceremony
sessions.description: The welcome ceremony will welcome all participants, highlight why Lab2Market exists, program expectations, an entrepreneurial host an Alumni Fireside chat, and let entrepreneur leads (ELs) briefly introduce themselves. This evening, ELs will watch a recorded lecture to prepare for the next day.

agenda.activity: Welcome, L2M Prairies Team Introductions, & Guest Speakers
Team Introductions (ELs - 2 Minutes Each) + Closing Remarks

todo.title: Evening Homework
items: **Assessing Risk (Part A):** [01_WATCH_VIDEO_Assessing_Risk_Part_A](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Gidhst4BbqCSii5h44uHFlYmPFHHuFzO/view?usp=drive_link)

**Read this:** [Briefing_Document_Assessing_Risk_PART_A](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ys-dtHJfL_8kOWunZxtbTMR5B9--Gc4F/edit?usp=drive_link&ouid=115984920499255154094&rtpof=true&sd=true) - This will prepare you for the activities for the next day (including a short quiz to test your knowledge in the morning)

sessions.title: Customers & Value
sessions.description: The morning will kick off to check EL‚Äôs understanding of the assigned recorded video lecture from the night before. The program tools Notion and Google Drive (how to access your Team Folder) will be introduced, followed by activities on choosing customer segments (CS), and how to write good CS and value proposition hypotheses. The day will wrap up with our guest speaker, to introduce you to Intellectual Property (IP). While Lab2Market Prairies / Validate is agnostic of IP, a high-level intellectual property workshop is included in the pre-program curriculum to ensure teams are aware of IP considerations and important questions they should be asking. During the presentation, our Andrew Tse will discuss Intellectual Property and how the University of Manitoba, North Forge, and other Tech Transfer Offices can support the process.

agenda.activity: Quiz #1 - Check Your Understanding: Assessing Risk (Part A)
Activity #1: Choosing Your Customer Segments Wisely
Activity #2: Writing Good Customer Segments & Value Proposition Hypotheses
Guest Speaker #1: Andrew Tse (PKMI) - Intellectual Property (IP)

sessions.title: Outreach & Networking
sessions.description: The morning will kick off to check EL‚Äôs understanding of the assigned recorded video lecture from the night before. This will be followed with an energizer activity, then an orientation on where to access their Customer Relationship Management (CRM) tool, followed by a quick touch base to ensure everyone can access their Innovation Within accounts. ELs will engage in activities for writing effective outreach scripts and to increase their networking skills. At the end of the day, the mentors will be introduced and then ELs and mentors will have the chance to get to know one another.

agenda.activity: Quiz #2 - Check Your Understanding: Assessing Risk (Part 2)
Program Tools #2: Customer Relationship Management + Innovation Within

sessions.title: Value Proposition Canvas & Interviews
sessions.description: The morning will kick off to check EL‚Äôs understanding of the assigned recorded video lecture from the night before. This will be followed with an energizer activity, then an orientation on how to use our main communication software, Slack. CS & VPs will continue to be explored through activities on creating customer profiles and value maps, and crafting scripts and interview questions for your stakeholders. ELs will meet with their assigned facilitator to go over the program expectations (e.g., deliverables, facilitator office hours, scrums, etc.) to help prepare ELs for success. This evening, ELs will watch a recorded lecture and complete homework to prepare for the next day.

Activity #5: Creating Customer Profiles & Value Maps Using the VPC
Activity #6: Writing Effective Value Proposition & Customer Segment Interview Questions

Engage socially on **Slack**. Connect with ELs, mentors, and facilitators.
Have Fun. ***If you are not having fun, you are not doing it right!***

sessions.title: Interview Practice & CRMs
sessions.description: The morning will kick off to check EL‚Äôs understanding of the assigned recorded video lecture from the night before. This will be followed with an energizer activity, then Demetre will introduce the EL Checklist and expectations. ELs will then engage in activities to practice interviewing and to learn how to strategically use their Customer Relationship Management (CRM) spreadsheet. Next, we‚Äôll have James O‚ÄôConnor from Innovation Within, who will demonstrate how to use the Business Model Canvas (BMC) and other features.

items: Notion, Slack, Innovation Within, and your Team folder contents

sessions.title: Meet With L2M Prairies Ops Team
Customer Segments & Market Sizing
sessions.description: The workshop teaches participants to understand customer segments through value proposition lessons, customer discovery, and customer segmentation tools like personas, helping them find early adopters using the technology adoption curve and market sizing approaches, ultimately enabling teams to identify customer segments, create personas, and form testable hypotheses for early adopters. A Mentor Pool Q&A Session will follow lunch, with the discussion to include questions about customer segments & market sizing.

agenda.activity: Scrum 1 - Customer Discovery. First Scrum to Review Introductions, Update/Present on Projects, Research, Etc.

todo.title: Reminder: Use your EL Weekly Checklist and complete the tasks before each session
Recommended Readings and Videos
items: Watch the following [video series](https://app.innovationwithin.com/course-videos) on the Innovation Within platform: Lecture 1.5A: Business Models and Customer Development & Lecture 1.5B: Business Models and Customer Development
Read *The Startup Owner‚Äôs Manual*: pp. 14-51 ‚ÄùDefinition of a Business Model"
Read *Business Model Generation*: The Customer Development Model, pp. 22‚Äì84 [19-83] & ‚ÄùPrepare for Customer Contacts,‚Äù pp. 195-199 [189-199]
Read *Giff Constable Blog Post*: ‚Äù[12 Tips for Early Customer Development Interviews](http://giffconstable.com/2012/12/12-tips-for-early-customer-development-interviews-)‚Äù

sessions.title: Customer Relationships & Channels
sessions.description: This session focuses on reaching target customers and utilizing channels to deliver the value proposition. It covers understanding the customer buying process, sales, distribution channels, and mapping the value chain and ecosystem for their solution. Ultimately, teams will gain insights into using customer discovery to understand the target customer's buying process and identify stakeholders in their ecosystem affecting solution adoption. A Mentor Pool Q&A Session will follow lunch, with the discussion to include questions about customer relationships & channels.

todo.title: Reminders
items: Social Session #2 (attendance highly encouraged) is this Thursday, April 16, 2026, from 12:00 pm - 1:00 pm
Use your **EL Weekly Checklist** and complete the tasks before each session

sessions.title: Key Activities, Resources, & Partners
sessions.description: This session addresses the feasibility of business models for early-stage deep tech projects (customer discovery, testing solutions, and refining through customer engagement). It also covers product development, partner engagement, minimal viable product (MVP), validation, and common pitfalls. A Mentor Pool Q&A Session will follow lunch, with the discussion to include questions about key activities, resources, and partners.

todo.title: Reminders
items: Use your **EL Weekly Checklist** and complete the tasks before each session

sessions.title: Mid-Program Review
sessions.description: Teams review interview results and their progress, focusing on mid-program presentations. Qualitative data analysis techniques and the concept of pivoting are discussed to derive valuable insights. Teams gain knowledge on when to pivot or persevere and assess their performance relative to peers. A Mentor Pool Q&A Session will follow lunch, with the discussion to include questions about pivoting or persevering.

agenda.activity: Scrum 4 Roundtable Discussion (Regular Group) - Pivot or Persevere

todo.title: Reminder
items: Use your **EL Weekly Checklist** and complete the tasks before each session

sessions.title: Business Model Viability
sessions.description: This session covers business model viability, payment methods, customer engagement in determining pricing, and cost drivers for deep tech businesses. Teams gain insights into suitable revenue streams, using customer discovery to estimate pricing preferences, and understanding key costs during commercialization. A Mentor Pool Q&A Session will follow lunch, with the discussion to include questions about business model viability.

todo.title: Reminder
items: Use your **EL Weekly Checklist** and complete the tasks before each session

sessions.title: Communicating Research & Pitching
sessions.description: This session focuses on how to communicate a value proposition and customer discovery results to various audiences. Strategies for how to communicate highly technical information to a non-specialist audience are provided, as well as best practices for creating a compelling story in the form of a pitch presentation. A Mentor Pool Q&A Session will follow lunch, with the discussion to include questions about communicating research & pitching.

sessions.title: Fundraising
sessions.description: This session provides a comprehensive overview of the fundraising process for commercializing deep tech. It covers funding sources, financing types, and steps to raise capital from investors. Participants will learn when to seek financing from various sources and gain awareness of available financing options and the overall fundraising process. This will be the final Mentor Pool Q&A Session, with the discussion to include questions about fundraising.

sessions.title: Final Presentation Practice + Next Steps
sessions.description:
**TODAY: Practice Run of Final Presentations with Facilitator Feedback**

*(Be prepared to deliver your final presentation for Final Presentations and Closing Ceremonies: Wednesday, May 20, 2026)*

Teams will do a practice run of their final presentations and receive feedback. This session will also cover the entrepreneurial ecosystem in Canada and the various resources that are available to you after the program. Ecosystem Partners will be present to share tips and advice for next steps you can take beyond this program, while Demetre Balaktsis will share information on the next steps within Lab2Market as well as will provide resources for our participants outside of Manitoba.
